context_bundle.summary: Rust fundamentals covering ownership system, borrowing rules, lifetimes, and memory safety without garbage collection

onboarding.quick_start: curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://sh.rustup.rs | sh && rustc --version && cargo new myproject && cd myproject && cargo build
common_patterns: Ownership: 'let s1 = String::from("hello"); let s2 = s1; // s1 moved, no longer valid'
Borrowing: 'fn calculate_length(s: &String) -> usize { s.len() } // immutable borrow'
Mutable borrow: 'fn change(s: &mut String) { s.push_str(", world"); } // only one mutable borrow at a time'
Lifetimes: 'fn longest<'a>(x: &'a str, y: &'a str) -> &'a str { if x.len() > y.len() { x } else { y } }'
Slice: 'let s = String::from("hello world"); let hello = &s[0..5];'
Copy trait: 'let x = 5; let y = x; // x still valid, Copy trait'
Clone: 'let s1 = String::from("hello"); let s2 = s1.clone(); // deep copy'
known_errors: borrow checker error: Check borrow rules, ensure no simultaneous mutable and immutable borrows
use of moved value: Clone value or use references, check ownership transfer
lifetime mismatch: Add explicit lifetime annotations, ensure references live long enough
cannot borrow as mutable: Ensure variable declared as 'let mut', check existing borrows
dangling reference: Return owned value instead of reference, or use 'static lifetime
cannot move out of borrowed content: Clone value or restructure to avoid move
